intro: Nemcia atropurpurea, commonly known as purplestem nemcia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its hairy, purple-stemmed foliage. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and wetland restoration projects.
